results.title: Delicatessen [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Constellation, UGC Images, Hachette Premiere, Claudie Ossard, Marc Caro and Jean-Pierre Jeunet
results.brief_description: Delicatessen is a bent French comedy from surrealist filmmaking collaborators Marc Caro and Jean-Pierre Jeunet. The film is set in a post-apocalyptic age, where food is a scarce and invaluable commodity, traded for grain, sex, board and life. “Delicatessen” centres around the cycles of one boarding house, ruled economically by the local butcher (Jean-Claude Dreyfus) who uses his power in the community to blackmail tenants into providing favours, including sexual, for food. Food supplies are kept topped up by the cannibalism of departing tenants, a fact depicted graphically in the opening credits. A young clown, (Dominique Pinon) applies for a job with the butcher and falls in love with the butcher’s daughter consequently upsetting the nervous energy of the boarding house, unaware that he too is destined for the butcher’s cleaver. The film is peppered with surreal dark imagery and scenes depicting decay, neglect and desperation as well as providing dim corners of hope where tenants hope to connect. “Delicatessen” is a film remarkable for its evocative set design and hypnotic score, winning many European awards in these categories. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Deep red
results.creator_credit: Rizzoli Film, Salvatore Argento, Spettacoli and Dario Argento
results.brief_description: Dario Argento’s blood thirsty thriller stars British actor David Hemmings. Witnessing the violent murder of a young parapsychologist, Hemmings embarks on a search for the murderer by following the trail of blood and destruction. “Deep red” is a film of relentless tension, with a bizarre ending and contains some of cinema’s most gripping film sequences. Italian dialogue. Dubbed in English.

results.title: Deep in my heart
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Roger Edens and Stanley Donen
results.brief_description: This film ‘biopic’ portrays the life of composer Sigmund Romberg, whose scores included “The Desert Song” and “Maytime”. While Broadway swings to the jazzy beat of ragtime, Romberg chooses to play the beautiful waltzes of his native country. When Romberg is convinced by the owner of the Cafe Vienna to try his hand at ragtime he writes a hit song in no time at all. Romberg writes one smash hit after another and eventually creates a hit show that takes Broadway by storm. Based on the book by Elliot Arnold. Stars Jose Ferrer, Merle Oberon, Helen Traubel, Walter Pidgeon with special guest appearances by Ann Miller, Rosemary Clooney, Cyd Charisse, Gene Kelly and Howard Keel.

results.title: Deep blue sea
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Akiva Goldsman, Robert Kosberg, Tony Ludwig, Don MacBain, Alan Richie and Renny Harlin
results.brief_description: Searching for a cure to Alzheimer’s disease a group of scientists on an isolated research facility become the bait as a trio of intelligent sharks fight back. Cast includes Saffron Burrows, Thomas Jane, LL Cool J, Jacqueline McKenzie, Michael Rapaport, Stellan Skarsgard, Aida Turturro.

results.title: Deconstructing Harry
results.creator_credit: Magnolia Productions, Sweetland Films BV, Jean Doumanian and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: Harry (Woody Allen), a New York author, has just released his latest novel “loosely” based on the characters from his own life - his ex-wives, mistresses, family and analysts. No-one likes his depiction of them, and in an hilariously ironic mixture of flashbacks to his new novel, flashbacks to his past, and mishaps in the present, the true story comes out. In classic Allen style, this autobiographical story is a fascinating mixture of fiction and reality. The cast is another line-up of characters in itself, including Kirstie Alley, Demi Moore, Robin Williams, Billy Crystal, Elisabeth Shue, Stanley Tucci, Amy Irving, Julie Kavner, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Mariel Hemingway and Judy Davis.

results.title: Death warmed up
results.creator_credit: Tucker Production Company, Murray Newey and David Blyth
results.brief_description: Michael Tucker (Michael Hurst) is programmed to kill his parents by genetic surgeon, Dr Archer Howell (Gary Day) and is incarcerated in a psychiatric institution for the crime. Years later, Michael and friends travel to an isolated Island where Howell now runs Transcranial Applications, experimenting on humans and turning them into mutant killing machines. Michael seeks revenge on Howell for the death of his parents but also to stop him for the sake of mankind. Co-starring Margaret Umbers, William Upjohn, Norelle Scott, Bruno Lawrence and David Letch.

results.title: Death in Venice
results.brief_description: Gustav Aschenbach (Dirk Bogarde) is a distinguished man, a world-famous conductor who embodies all the civilised virtues of the European culture he represents. Yet on a solitary holiday in Venice, he spies an innocent boy - and abandons himself to a secret passion that carries him to his doom. Lyrical, intelligent and heartbreakingly beautiful “Death in Venice” accompanied by the haunting music of Gustav Mahler, will leave its echo in your memory for years to come. Based on Thomas Mann’s classic novel ‘Death in Venice’, Visconti’s film was voted Grand Prix winner at the 1971 Cannes Film Festival. Also stars Marc Burns, Bjorn Andresen and Silvana Mangano.

results.title: Death in Brunswick (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Meridian Films, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Film Victoria, Timothy White and John Ruane
results.brief_description: Carl Fitzgerald (Sam Neill) is the hard-luck hero in this pleasant little black comedy set in the Melbourne suburb of Brunswick. Carl lands a chef’s job in the cockroach infested kitchen of a dodgy nightclub. He meets a luscious young barmaid (Zoe Carides) who has the hots for him, but as luck would have it, the rocky romance is headed for trouble when an unfortunate incident at the club embroils Carl in a complicated mess. He enlists the help of his mate Dave (John Clarke)…things can only get worse from here on.

results.title: Death and the maiden
results.creator_credit: Behind the Scenes, Thom Mount, Josh Kramer and Roman Polanski
results.brief_description: What if you had the chance to seek revenge for the crimes committed against you? Paulina Escobar (Sigourney Weaver), is faced with this moral dilemma when she confronts who she believes was her tormentor; a sadistic doctor who subjected her to physical, sexual and mental abuse 15 years ago when she was held hostage by South American Government interrogators. Paulina leads a quiet and nervous lifestyle with her husband (Stuart Wilson). This shaky semblance of peace is disrupted when her husband is brought home by a good Samaritan (Ben Kingsley) when his car breaks down during a storm. Alarm bells ring when Paulina recognises the voice from her blindfolded ordeal. Her husband is not convinced he is the offender and as a lawyer is challenged by her to present a case against the conviction.
